question_text: Which of the following accurately describe DOCSIS and cable modem deployments? (Select all that apply)
answer_options: DOCSIS enables gigabit data speeds over coax
DOCSIS modems share bandwidth across subscribers in a neighborhood
DOCSIS allows direct modulation of DSL signals over copper
DOCSIS requires fiber-optic connections to the modem
DOCSIS modems can deliver data, voice, and video services
correct_answer: DOCSIS enables gigabit data speeds over coax
DOCSIS modems share bandwidth across subscribers in a neighborhood
DOCSIS modems can deliver data, voice, and video services
explanation: DOCSIS supports high-speed data over coax and is designed for triple-play services. Bandwidth is shared among nearby users.
